meanings.definition: Relating to or dealing with the historical development of different ethnic groups.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed an ethnohistoric exhibit showcasing the diverse cultures of the region.
meanings.sent2: Researchers study ethnohistoric artifacts to learn about the past interactions between various ethnic communities.
meanings.sent3: The ethnohistoric research team had a picnic to celebrate their latest findings.
meanings.sent4: Her ethnohistoric analysis of the ancient texts revealed fascinating connections between tribes.
meanings.sent5: The ethnohistoric timeline vividly illustrated the evolution of cultural practices over centuries.

meanings.definition: A record or account of the history of a particular ethnic group.
meanings.sent1: The library archives contain a valuable ethnohistoric document detailing the traditions of the tribe.
meanings.sent2: Historians rely on ethnohistoric accounts to understand the customs of indigenous peoples.
meanings.sent3: The ethnohistoric journal was filled with colorful illustrations of tribal ceremonies.
meanings.sent4: Reading the ethnohistoric narrative felt like stepping back in time to witness ancient rituals.
meanings.sent5: The ethnohistoric record painted a vivid picture of the struggles and triumphs of the community.
